Surface Transportation Adaptability to Ensure Safety (STATES) Act of 2005
A bill to amend title 23, United States Code, to permit States to carry out surface transportation program projects on local roads to address safety concerns.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

bill.summary: Surface Transportation Adaptability to Ensure Safety (STATES) Act of 2005 - Amends Federal highway law to authorize a State to undertake a surface transportation program project on any State-maintained public road, including a road functionally classified as a local or rural minor collector, if the State determines that the project is necessary to address high fatality rates or other safety concerns.
